transportAdvice: Antwerp's historic center is compact and very walkable, with most major attractions reachable on foot. The city also has an extensive network of trams, buses, and a pre-metro system that covers tourist areas well, and taxis are readily available throughout the city.

weather.description: Cold and grey with frequent rain and occasional frost, typical of a Belgian winter.
Still cold and damp with overcast skies, though daylight hours begin to slowly increase.
Early spring brings milder temperatures and occasional sunny spells between showers.
Pleasant spring weather with blooming trees, though showers remain common.
Warm and increasingly sunny, one of the more enjoyable months to visit.
Warm early summer with long daylight hours and occasional thunderstorms.
The warmest month of the year with long days, though brief rain showers are still possible.
Warm and pleasant with similar conditions to July, ideal for outdoor sightseeing.
Early autumn brings cooler evenings but still comfortable daytime temperatures.
Noticeably cooler and wetter as autumn sets in, with shorter days.
Cold, damp, and often foggy, with limited daylight and frequent rain.
Cold and grey with festive Christmas markets offering a cozy reason to visit despite the chill.
